Row.Text: Thus created were the islands,[NEWLINE] Rocks were fastened in the ocean,[NEWLINE] Pillars of the sky were planted,[NEWLINE] Fields and forests were created,[NEWLINE] Checkered stones of many colors,[NEWLINE] Gleaming in the silver sunlight,[NEWLINE] All the rocks stood well established;[NEWLINE] But the singer, Wainamoinen,[NEWLINE] Had not yet beheld the sunshine,[NEWLINE] Had not seen the golden moonlight,[NEWLINE] Still remaining undelivered.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune I)

"I the seeds of life am sowing,[NEWLINE] Sowing through my open fingers,[NEWLINE] From the hand of my Creator,[NEWLINE] In this soil enriched with ashes,[NEWLINE] In this soil to sprout and flourish.[NEWLINE] Ancient mother, thou that livest[NEWLINE] Far below the earth and ocean,[NEWLINE] Mother of the fields and forests,[NEWLINE] Bring the rich soil to producing,[NEWLINE] Bring the seed-grains to the sprouting,[NEWLINE] That the barley well may flourish."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune II)

Far away in dismal Northland,[NEWLINE] Lived the singer, Joukahainen,[NEWLINE] Lapland's young and reckless minstrel,[NEWLINE] Once upon a time when feasting,[NEWLINE] Dining with his friends and fellows,[NEWLINE] Came upon his ears the story[NEWLINE] That there lived a sweeter singer,[NEWLINE] On the meadows of Wainola,[NEWLINE] On the plains of Kalevala,[NEWLINE] Better skilled in chanting legends,[NEWLINE] Better skilled than Joukahainen,[NEWLINE] Better than the one that taught him.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune III)

As the day dawns, looking round her,[NEWLINE] She beholds three water-maidens,[NEWLINE] On a headland jutting seaward,[NEWLINE] Water-maidens four in number,[NEWLINE] Sitting on the wave-lashed ledges,[NEWLINE] Swimming now upon the billows,[NEWLINE] Now upon the rocks reposing.[NEWLINE] Quick the weeping maiden, Aino,[NEWLINE] Hastens there to join the mermaids,[NEWLINE] Fairy maidens of the waters.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune IV)

Of the mothers air is oldest,[NEWLINE] Water is the oldest brother,[NEWLINE] And the fire is second brother,[NEWLINE] And the youngest brother, iron;[NEWLINE] Ukko is the first creator.[NEWLINE] Ukko, maker of the heavens,[NEWLINE] Cut apart the air and water,[NEWLINE] Ere was born the metal, iron.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune IX)

Now the master, Ilmarinen,[NEWLINE] The renowned and skilful blacksmith,[NEWLINE] From the fire removes the iron,[NEWLINE] Places it upon the anvil,[NEWLINE] Hammers well until it softens,[NEWLINE] Hammers many fine utensils,[NEWLINE] Hammers spears, and swords, and axes,[NEWLINE] Hammers knives, and forks, and hatchets,[NEWLINE] Hammers tools of all descriptions.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune IX)

On the third night Ilmarinen,[NEWLINE] Bending low to view his metals,[NEWLINE] On the bottom of the furnace,[NEWLINE] Sees the magic Sampo rising,[NEWLINE] Sees the lid in many colors.[NEWLINE] Quick the artist of Wainola[NEWLINE] Forges with the tongs and anvil,[NEWLINE] Knocking with a heavy hammer,[NEWLINE] Forges skilfully the Sampo;[NEWLINE] On one side the flour is grinding,[NEWLINE] On another salt is making,[NEWLINE] On a third is money forging,[NEWLINE] And the lid is many-colored.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune X)

Now the mother well anointing,[NEWLINE] Heals her son, the magic singer,[NEWLINE] Eyes, and ears, and tongue, and temples,[NEWLINE] Breaks, and cuts, and seams, anointing,[NEWLINE] Touching well the life-blood centres,[NEWLINE] Speaks these words of magic import[NEWLINE] To the sleeping Lemminkainen:[NEWLINE] "Wake, arise from out thy slumber,[NEWLINE] From the worst of low conditions,[NEWLINE] From thy state of dire misfortune![NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XV)

Wainamoinen, ancient minstrel,[NEWLINE] The eternal wisdom-singer,[NEWLINE] For his boat was working lumber,[NEWLINE] Working long upon his vessel,[NEWLINE] On a fog-point jutting seaward,[NEWLINE] On an island, forest-covered;[NEWLINE] But the lumber failed the master,[NEWLINE] Beams were wanting for his vessel,[NEWLINE] Beams and scantling, ribs and flooring.[NEWLINE] Who will find for him the lumber,[NEWLINE] Who procure the timber needed[NEWLINE] For the boat of Wainamoinen,[NEWLINE] For the bottom of his vessel?[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XVI)

When the loaves were baked and ready.[NEWLINE] When the dishes all were seasoned,[NEWLINE] Time had gone but little distance,[NEWLINE] Scarce a moment had passed over,[NEWLINE] Ere the beer, in casks imprisoned,[NEWLINE] Loudly rapped, and sang, and murmured:[NEWLINE] "Come, ye heroes, come and take me,[NEWLINE] Come and let me cheer your spirits,[NEWLINE] Make you sing the songs of wisdom,[NEWLINE] That with honor ye may praise me,[NEWLINE] Sing the songs of beer immortal![NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XX)

Quick became a fish-bone artist,[NEWLINE] Made a harp of wondrous beauty,[NEWLINE] Lasting joy and pride of Finland.[NEWLINE] Whence the harp's enchanting arches?[NEWLINE] From the jaw-bones of the monster.[NEWLINE] Whence the necessary harp-pins?[NEWLINE] From the pike-teeth firmly fastened.[NEWLINE] Whence the sweetly singing harp-strings?[NEWLINE] From the tail of Lempo's stallion.[NEWLINE] Thus was born the harp of magic[NEWLINE] From the mighty pike of Northland,[NEWLINE] From the relies from the feasting[NEWLINE] Of the heroes of Wainola.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XL)

"Should this prayer prove unavailing,[NEWLINE] Iku-Turso, son of Old-age,[NEWLINE] Raise thy head above the billows,[NEWLINE] And destroy Wainola's heroes,[NEWLINE] Sink them to thy deep sea-castles,[NEWLINE] There devour them at thy pleasure;[NEWLINE] Bring thou back the golden Sampo[NEWLINE] To the people of Pohjola!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XLII)

Wainamoinen, ancient minstrel,[NEWLINE] Saw the fragments of the treasure[NEWLINE] Floating on the billows landward,[NEWLINE] Fragments of the lid in colors,[NEWLINE] Much rejoicing, spake as follows:[NEWLINE] "Thence will come the sprouting seed-grain,[NEWLINE] The beginning of good fortune,[NEWLINE] The unending of resources,[NEWLINE] From the plowing and the sowing,[NEWLINE] From the glimmer of the moonlight,[NEWLINE] From the splendor of the sunshine,[NEWLINE] On the fertile plains of Finland,[NEWLINE] On the meads of Kalevala."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XLIII)

Kullerwoinen, wicked wizard,[NEWLINE] Answers thus his grieving mother:[NEWLINE] "I can never hide from sorrow,[NEWLINE] Cannot flee from my misconduct;[NEWLINE] To the jaws of death I hasten,[NEWLINE] To the open courts of Kalma,[NEWLINE] To the hunting-grounds of Northland,[NEWLINE] To the battle-fields of heroes.[NEWLINE] Untamoinen still is living,[NEWLINE] Unmolested roams the wicked,[NEWLINE] Unavenged my father's grievance,[NEWLINE] Unavenged my mother's tortures,[NEWLINE] Unavenged the wrongs I suffer!"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XXXV)
Louhi Steals Sun, Moon and Fire (Rune XLVII)

Louhi, hostess of Pohjola,[NEWLINE] Northland's old and toothless wizard,[NEWLINE] Makes the Sun and Moon her captives;[NEWLINE] In her arms she takes fair Luna[NEWLINE] From her cradle in the birch-tree,[NEWLINE] Calls the Sun down from his station,[NEWLINE] From the fir-tree's bending branches,[NEWLINE] Carries them to upper Northland,[NEWLINE] To the darksome Sariola;[NEWLINE] Hides the Moon, no more to glimmer,[NEWLINE] In a rock of many colors;[NEWLINE] Hides the Sun, to shine no longer,[NEWLINE] In the iron-banded mountain.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune XLVII)

"Suns may rise and set in Finland,[NEWLINE] Rise and set for generations,[NEWLINE] When the North will learn my teachings,[NEWLINE] Will recall my wisdom-sayings,[NEWLINE] Hungry for the true religion.[NEWLINE] Then will Finland need my coming,[NEWLINE] Watch for me at dawn of morning,[NEWLINE] That I may bring back the Sampo,[NEWLINE] Bring anew the harp of joyance,[NEWLINE] Bring again the golden moonlight,[NEWLINE] Bring again the silver sunshine,[NEWLINE] Peace and plenty to the Northland."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE] (Rune L)
